gw.api.json

Class JsonSerializationOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.json.JsonSerializationOptions

  • public class JsonSerializationOptions
extends java.lang.Object
    Serialization of both JsonObject and TransformResult can be parameterized with various options that affect the resulting output. Many of the options apply to both JSON and XML serialization, while some only apply to JSON serialization.

    • Constructor Detail

      • JsonSerializationOptions

        public JsonSerializationOptions()
        Creates a new JsonSerializationOptions object with null values for all options. Note that default behavior for options is partially dependent upon context, and can differ slightly between JsonObject and TransformResult serialization.

    • Method Detail

      • getValidateOutput

        public boolean getValidateOutput(boolean defaultValue)
        Returns the value of the validateOutput option, or the specified default value if validateOutput is null
        Parameters:
        defaultValue - the default value to use if validateOutput is null
        Returns:
        the value of the validateOutput option, or the specified default value if validateOutput is null

      • setValidateOutput

        public JsonSerializationOptions setValidateOutput(java.lang.Boolean validateOutput)
        Sets the validateOutput serialization option. If true, the output will get validated. The default for JsonObject and TransformResult serialization is "false" for this option.
        Parameters:
        validateOutput - the value for the option
        Returns:
        this JsonSerializationOptions object, for call chaining

      • getIncludeEmptyArrays

        public boolean getIncludeEmptyArrays(boolean defaultValue)
        Returns the value of the includeEmptyArrays option, or the specified default value if includeEmptyArrays is null
        Parameters:
        defaultValue - the default value to use if includeEmptyArrays is null
        Returns:
        the value of the includeEmptyArrays option, or the specified default value if includeEmptyArrays is null

      • setIncludeEmptyArrays

        public JsonSerializationOptions setIncludeEmptyArrays(java.lang.Boolean includeEmptyArrays)
        Sets the includeEmptyArrays serialization option. If true, empty arrays will always be serialized. If false, properties whose value is an empty array will be treated as if they were null. The default for JsonObject serialization is "true" for this option, while the default for TransformResult serialization is "false."

        This option combines with both the includeNullProperties option and the includeNullItems option. If this option is false, and includeNullItems is false, an array containing only null items will be treated as if it were null. If this option is false and includeNullProperties is false, then empty lists will not be included in the output at all.

        Parameters:
        includeEmptyArrays - the value for the option
        Returns:
        this JsonSerializationOptions object, for call chaining

      • getIncludeNullProperties

        public boolean getIncludeNullProperties(boolean defaultValue)
        Returns the value of the includeNullProperties option, or the specified default value if includeNullProperties is null
        Parameters:
        defaultValue - the default value to use if includeNullProperties is null
        Returns:
        the value of the includeNullProperties option, or the specified default value if includeNullProperties is null

      • setIncludeNullProperties

        public JsonSerializationOptions setIncludeNullProperties(java.lang.Boolean includeNullProperties)
        Sets the includeNullProperties option. If true, properties with null values will be included in the output. For JSON serialization, they will be given explicit null values. For XML serialization, they will be empty elements with xsi:nil="true". The default for this option is "false" for both JsonObject and TransformResult serialization.
        Parameters:
        includeNullProperties - the value for the option
        Returns:
        this JsonSerializationOptions object, for call chaining

      • getIncludeNullItems

        public boolean getIncludeNullItems(boolean defaultValue)
        Returns the value of the includeNullItems option, or the specified default value if includeNullItems is null
        Parameters:
        defaultValue - the default value to use if includeNullItems is null
        Returns:
        the value of the includeNullItems option, or the specified default value if includeNullItems is null

      • setIncludeNullItems

        public JsonSerializationOptions setIncludeNullItems(java.lang.Boolean includeNullItems)
        Sets the includeNullItems option. If true, null values within arrays will be preserved in the output. For JSON serialization, an explicit null value will be used, and for XML serialization the child element will be represented as an empty element with xsi:nil="true". The default for this option is "false" for both JsonObject and TransformResult serialization.
        Parameters:
        includeNullItems - the value for the option
        Returns:
        this JsonSerializationOptions object, for call chaining

      • getIncludeSchemaProperty

        public boolean getIncludeSchemaProperty(boolean defaultValue)
        Returns the value of the includeSchemaProperty option, or the specified default value if includeSchemaProperty is null
        Parameters:
        defaultValue - the default value to use if includeSchemaProperty is null
        Returns:
        the value of the includeSchemaProperty option, or the specified default value if includeSchemaProperty is null

      • setIncludeSchemaProperty

        public JsonSerializationOptions setIncludeSchemaProperty(java.lang.Boolean includeSchemaProperty)
        Sets the includeSchemaProperty option. If true, JSON output will include the $GW-Schema property on the root object with the fully-qualified name of the JSON schema definition for that root object. Only relevant for serialization to JSON of either a TransformResult or a JsonObject that is being serialized with a schema. The default value is "false."
        Parameters:
        includeSchemaProperty - the value for the option
        Returns:
        this JsonSerializationOptions object, for call chaining

      • getIncludeCorrelationId

        public boolean getIncludeCorrelationId(boolean defaultValue)
        Returns the value of the includeCorrelationId option, or the specified default value if includeCorrelationId is null
        Parameters:
        defaultValue - the default value to use if includeCorrelationId is null
        Returns:
        the value of the includeCorrelationId option, or the specified default value if includeCorrelationId is null

      • setIncludeCorrelationId

        public JsonSerializationOptions setIncludeCorrelationId(java.lang.Boolean includeCorrelationId)
        Sets the includeCorrelationId option. If true, JSON output will include the $GW-Correlation-ID property on the root object containing the current traceability context id, if any. Only relevant for serialization of a TransformResult object into JSON. The default value is "false".
        Parameters:
        includeCorrelationId - the value for the option
        Returns:
        this JsonSerializationOptions object, for call chaining

      • getIncludeTimestamp

        public boolean getIncludeTimestamp(boolean defaultValue)
        Returns the value of the includeTimestamp option, or the specified default value if includeTimestamp is null
        Parameters:
        defaultValue - the default value to use if includeTimestamp is null
        Returns:
        the value of the includeTimestamp option, or the specified default value if includeTimestamp is null

      • setIncludeTimestamp

        public JsonSerializationOptions setIncludeTimestamp(java.lang.Boolean includeTimestamp)
        Sets the includeTimestamp serialization option. If true, JSON output will include the $GW-Timestamp property on the root object with the timestamp used for the current transaction, if serialization is happening within the context of a database commit, or the current system clock time. The data will be formatted as an ISO-8601 date-time. Only relevant for serialization of a TransformResult into JSON. The default value is "false".
        Parameters:
        includeTimestamp - the value for the option
        Returns:
        this JsonSerializationOptions object, for call chaining

      • getIncludeUser

        public boolean getIncludeUser(boolean defaultValue)
        Returns the value of the includeUser option, or the specified default value if includeUser is null
        Parameters:
        defaultValue - the default value to use if includeUser is null
        Returns:
        the value of the includeUser option, or the specified default value if includeUser is null

      • setIncludeUser

        public JsonSerializationOptions setIncludeUser(java.lang.Boolean includeUser)
        Sets the includeUser serialization option. If true, JSON output will include the $GW-User property on the root object containing the username of the current user, if any. The current user could either be the user that a database transaction is running on behalf of or the currently-authenticated user for a web or API request. Only relevant for serialization of a TransformResult into JSON. The default value is "false".
        Parameters:
        includeUser - the value for the option
        Returns:
        this JsonSerializationOptions object, for call chaining

      • getIncludeServer

        public boolean getIncludeServer(boolean defaultValue)
        Returns the value of the includeServer option, or the specified default value if includeServer is null
        Parameters:
        defaultValue - the default value to use if includeServer is null
        Returns:
        the value of the includeServer option, or the specified default value if includeServer is null

      • setIncludeServer

        public JsonSerializationOptions setIncludeServer(java.lang.Boolean includeServer)
        Sets the includeServer serialization option. If true, JSON output will include the $GW-Server property on the root object with the current serverId. Only relevant for serialization of a TransformResult into JSON. The default value is "false".
        Parameters:
        includeServer - the value for the option
        Returns:
        this JsonSerializationOptions object, for call chaining
